Title.evidence: Development of Enhanced Recovery After Surgery (ERAS) Guidelines for Colorectal Cancer: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: The unit of randomisation was the individual study, with sample size determined by the availability of randomised controlled trials (RCTs) and propensity score-matched studies.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included studies on colorectal cancer surgeries.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved implementing ERAS protocols, while the comparator was standard postoperative care.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of postoperative complications, assessed within 30 days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not detailed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 9 studies were included

Result_Outcome.evidence: showing significant reductions in postoperative complication rates in the intervention group (odds ratio [OR], 0.70; 95% confidence interval [CI], 0.51 to 0.97).
